abstract: Daniele De Rossi, Ufficiale OMRI (Italian pronunciation: [daˈnjɛle de ˈrossi]; born 24 July 1983) is an Italian footballer who plays as a midfielder for Serie A club A.S. Roma. He was the Roma's vice-captain and nicknamed as Capitan Futuro (English: Future Captain) due to his high probability as heir-apparent to Francesco Totti's captain armband.De Rossi is recognised as a "complete midfielder", because of his tackling, passing, strength and shooting. He is a versatile player who can play in defence and in attack.With Roma he has won the Coppa Italia twice and the 2007 Supercoppa Italiana. He was named Serie A Young Footballer of the Year in 2006 and the Italian Footballer of the Year in 2009.De Rossi has represented Italy at under-19, under-20, under-21, and senior levels. He was part of the 2006 FIFA World Cup winning-squad and has also participated at Euro 2008, the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup, the 2010 FIFA World Cup, the Euro 2012 and 2013 FIFA Confederations Cup.
